summary:
Plan B is a New York based technology firm specializing in the design, implementation and support of converged voice, data, and Internet solutions. Plan B Technology takes a consultative approach to understanding our clients business needs, issues and concerns. With this approach we can develop a specific technology plan that meets and exceeds our client’s goals. We also provide a comprehensive audit of all our clients’ carrier service bills, service & support contracts, cellular plans, merchant services and utility (gas & electric).  Our clients range from the small startups to enterprise multi-location corporations. Plan B’s dedicated technical support team is there every step of the way, from concept to completion. 

The following is a list of solutions and services we provide:
•	Traditional  & IP PBX platforms
•	Business Continuity/Cloud Solutions (Hosted PBX, VoIP, Data Center, DR/Backup)
•	Carrier Services (Verizon, Cablevision/Lightpath, etc.)
•	Audits ( Voice, Data, Cellular, and  Maintenance Support Contracts)
•	Infrastructure Cabling (Voice, Data, Fiber and Ariel/underground)
•	On-site maintenance and support

In addition to the services above, Plan B also provides consulting and project management services to aide clients with existing provider and vendor solutions.  We act as an advocate for the client to ensure that they are implementing the right solution and that the project gets completed on time.

For more information please contact Edward Cunningham at 631-773-1152 or ed@planbtechnology.net.

education school linkedin description (2:
Since 1847, The City College of New York has provided a high quality and affordable education to generations of New Yorkers in a wide variety of disciplines. CCNY embraces its role at the forefront of social change. It is ranked #1 by The Chronicle of Higher Education out of 369 selective public colleges in the United States on the overall mobility index. This measure reflects both access and outcomes, representing the likelihood that a student at CCNY can move up two or more income quintiles. In addition, the Center for World University Rankings places CCNY in the top 1.2% of universities worldwide in terms of academic excellence. More than 15,000 students pursue undergraduate and graduate degrees in eight professional schools and divisions, driven by significant funded research, creativity and scholarship. 

CCNY is as diverse, dynamic and visionary as New York City itself. Outstanding programs in architecture, engineering, education and the liberal arts and sciences prepare our students for the future, and produce outstanding leaders in every field. Whether they are drawn to the traditional, like philosophy or sociology, or emerging fields like sonic arts or biomedical engineering, our baccalaureate graduates go on to graduate programs at Stanford, Columbia or MIT – or they stay right here in one of our 50 master's programs or our doctoral programs in engineering, the laboratory sciences, and psychology. 

Nowhere else in the city do undergraduates have so many opportunities to conduct research with professors and publish and present their findings. In our science, engineering and social science programs, more than 300 undergrads work alongside senior researchers in funded projects. Leading CUNY in funded research, we house a number of research centers. Nearly all of our full-time faculty hold PhDs or—like our architecture faculty—maintain professional practices. Art professors exhibit their work, film professors make films, and music professors perform in venues

summary:
Danielle is a holistic marketer who believes in positive change through food. Her specialty is marketing and communicating mission-based food companies and initiatives for brand awareness, engagement, and growth. Danielle thinks about sustainable growth in a holistic framework that breaks down silos between teams to achieve common growth goals, using data-driven strategies, attributable marketing tactics, and embracing new technologies like AI artificial intelligence. 

Danielle has been working with mission-driven food companies since 2010. Her expertise is driving growth through marketing and communications, with a data-driven approach; helping for-profit companies grow their communities and sell more of what they love (b corp businesses). Danielle has been managing cross-functional teams since 2014 and has years of executive leadership team experience for small companies. As a team leader, she is focused on building inclusive company culture driven by clear alignment on company vision and mission to achieve results. Danielle has food startup experience, driving growth through digital messaging, and strategic partnerships. She is an online grocery expert (grocery ecommerce) with direct-to-consumer (DTC) ecommerce growth experience. She has overseen communication strategies, a/b split testing, and other responsibilities in an ever-changing high-growth environment. 

Danielle also has experience in the hospitality industry, working in restaurants, agriturismi, and teaching farms in Italy and managing distributor relationships with many restaurants in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and the larger USA. She also created, marketed, and executed on a dinner series called the Warehouse Supper Club in the Bronx which ran for 5 years. 

Danielle has expert knowledge of artisanal Italian food production, farming, and importing. She played an important role in the publication of "Food Chains Mystery Of San Marzano" in the New York Times. She is mentioned in James Beard winner Paul Greenberg's book Omega-3 for her work with Cetara Anchovy production.

Danielle co-founded Palermo Street Food in Palermo, Sicily, and played a pivotal role in the production of Ainsley Eats the Street Palermo episode which can be found on Netflix. 

Danielle has a Bachelor's degree in Cultural Anthropology, specialized in ethnographic data/work, from Reed College and a Master's degree in Management from The University of Bocconi (SDA Bocconi). She currently lives in New York City but can often be found in Italy, where she is also a citizen; her home base is Palermo.

job description (2):
rePurpose Global is on an ambitious mission to end plastic waste—a challenge we tackle by partnering with 450+ leading brands like Colgate, PepsiCo, and Thrive Market. Together, we’ve already removed over 75M pounds of plastic waste from global hotspots while helping businesses reduce plastic use upstream. The Strategic Advisory Network brings together changemakers across industries to support rePurpose’s mission of driving systems change and eliminating plastic waste. Together, we aim to create measurable impact and drive the world toward a more sustainable, circular future.
	•	Advise on innovative, real-world solutions to reduce plastic waste
	•	Collaborate with a dynamic network of industry experts and brands
	•	Help shape responsible packaging, supply chains, and global policy insights
	•	Amplify the plastic-free movement through thought leadership and strategic connections
linkedin description (2):
rePurpose Global is the world’s leading Plastic Action Platform, bringing together brands, consumers, innovators, and policymakers to collectively combat the plastic waste crisis. Through its pioneering solutions across the circular economy, rePurpose has helped more than 500 companies measure, reduce, and take action on their plastic footprints, while driving systems change on a global scale.

rePurpose Impact Projects have recovered over 30 million kilograms of plastic waste from the environment to date, protecting vulnerable coastal regions across the Americas, Africa, and Asia. In doing so, the organization has enabled the delivery of waste management services to millions of people for the first time, while positively impacting the lives of thousands of marginalized waste workers across the world.

Founded in 2016, rePurpose Global now employs over 70 full-time team members across offices worldwide. For more information, please visit https://repurpose.global/.

If you'd like to work with us, head on over to our Careers Page to look at the open positions and browse through their job descriptions: https://www.business.repurpose.global/careers

summary: Atif Butt is an accomplished Cybersecurity professional who has successfully led and developed comprehensive Cybersecurity programs. At the NBA, he oversees DevSecOps, AppSec, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security, Offensive Security, and Infrastructure Vulnerability Management domains. Among other responsibilities at the NBA, he provides governance, risk, and advisory services to all the teams. Prior to Atif's tenure at the NBA, he managed global I.T. internal audit assurance services at Tyco International and later transitioned to a governance, risk, and compliance role.\n\nAtif has a B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from NJIT and an M.Sc. in Information Security Engineering from SANS Technology Institute. He has also earned industry-recognized certifications, including CISSP, CIA, and ABCP, as well as numerous GIAC Information Security certifications.
job description: As the leader of diverse Cybersecurity disciplines at the NBA, Atif Butt orchestrated the development and oversight of critical programs, including application security, cyber threat intelligence, incident response, threat and vulnerability management, DevSecOps, cloud security, and offensive security. Atif’s strategic impact extends to the establishment of a Cybersecurity governance, risk, and compliance framework for NBA teams. As the designated Cybersecurity lead, he provides advisory services on cyber risk matters to all NBA teams, overseeing the development, maintenance, and implementation of information security governance, risk, and compliance programs.

The SANS Technology Institute is the preeminent college preparing the next generation of cyber security professionals for what they will face in the field. Our programs are distinguished by our world-class faculty; our emphasis on hands-on learning in SANS courses, most of which lead to industry-recognized GIAC certifications; our innovative online and in-person course delivery options; and the proven success of our alumni.  Cybersecurity is all we teach and nobody does it better.

The SANS Institute is the largest and by far most trusted provider of information security training in the world. An independent subsidiary of SANS, the SANS Technology Institute offers graduate programs (master's degree and graduate certificates) that develop technically-adept leaders and undergraduate programs (bachelor's degree and undergraduate certificate) for people who want to enter the cybersecurity field.  

Explore the full range of graduate and undergraduate programs offered at www.sans.edu.

The SANS Technology Institute is accredited by The Middle States Commission on Higher Education (3624 Market Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104 - 267.284.5000), an institutional accrediting agency recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation.

Welcome to New Jersey’s science and technology university. NJIT is New Jersey's science and technology university. We're proud of our 125 years of history, but that's just the beginning. Academics

NJIT offers 128 undergraduate and graduate degree programs in six specialized schools instructed by expert faculty, 98 percent of whom hold the highest degree in their field. Our academic programs are fully accredited by the appropriate accrediting boards, commissions and associations such as Middle States, ABET, and NAAB.

Student Body

We have amazing students from all over the world, and we rank #1 in New Jersey in awarding engineering degrees to African-American and Hispanic students. 

Learning Options

Our extensive Continuing and Professional Education programs and online courses offer important training for professionals already on the job and our competitive industry internships help land you one of your own.

Our Campus

summary:
Cornerstone Community Partners a Benefit Corporation

A COLLABORATIVE MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM
Our collaborative and multidisciplinary team believes in the power of business and real estate development to solve social and environmental problems. As an official Pennsylvania Benefit Corporation (B Corp), we look forward to the opportunity to lead by example, adding our voice to a community that seeks not just to do good, but to do better.

The Cornerstone Community Partners is a multidisciplinary team of real estate professionals engaged in setting strategic direction for the development of mixed use, residential and affordable community development initiatives.  Our collaborative team approach fosters civic engagement, progressive design and social innovation that attract both public and private investment. Together we strive for broad sector coordination that creates vibrant communities and future opportunities for community and economic development. This collaborative approach is unique in the region and results in the highest quality product for our clients, partners and neighbors. We realize that every structure we build, every street we pave, every tree we plant, every public square we shape and every service that we deliver contributes to the legacy we leave for those who will live in or visit our community after us.
job description:
Creating Public/Private Partnerships to develop "New Urban" communities with inclusion of mixed use and a variety of diverse housing options.

Creative Solutions
Walk-ability, beauty, sociability, and access to activities are critical ingredients in designing for people. When these elements are brought together through careful, smart design, our communities become timeless places for people who want safety, convenience, and choices in where they live, how they get around and where they go.

Community and real estate development are the Cornerstones of our business. And our CCP team and affiliated partnerships have an extensive and diverse track record that includes the planning, design, development and construction of large Planned Residential Communities (PRD’s), mixed use Planned Unit Developments (PUD’s), Traditional Neighborhood Developments (TND’s) , Transportation Oriented Development’s (TOD’s) as well as affordable workforce, supportive, and senior housing communities.

linkedin description (4): Milan, 1984: a plaque outside a small office shows the surnames Dolce&Gabbana, almost as if it were a professional studio. Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana, with only two million lire in their pockets, thus began to write the history of the brand that they would have founded shortly after, in 1985, giving life to an all-Italian dream made up of craftsmanship, tailoring tradition, Mediterranean culture, innovation instinct and a pinch of irony. The first clothing collections would follow over time with a wide and varied offer, an expression of dedication, study and research: a virtuous path that culminates in 2012 with the dream of high fashion.\n     \nBehind every Dolce&Gabbana creation lie the secrets of many crafts, the devotion to work, attention to detail and love for beauty. After more than thirty-five years, Dolce&Gabbana continues to be inspired by Italian art, traditions and culture by offering clothes, accessories, jewellery and watches that embody a unique heritage of knowledge and emotions.

The L’OCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. 
Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: Maison L'Occitane en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L’OCCITANE au Brésil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze. 
Innovative venture studio OBRATORI is also part of the Group. 

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L’OCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet.
The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature. 
The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B Corporation.

education school (1): State University of New York Maritime College
education school linkedin description (1:
SUNY Maritime College, in New York City, prepares its 1,800 students for careers in shipping and transportation, government, military, business and power generation. Many students pursue U.S. Coast Guard licenses, which qualifies them to work on offshore vessels. 

SUNY Maritime College offers bachelor's degrees in: Mechanical Engineering, Facilities Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Marine Engineering, Naval Architecture, Marine Transportation, Marine Operations, International Transportation and Trade, Maritime Studies and Marine Environmental Science, as well as an associates degree in Marine Technology/Small Vessel Operations.

Two graduate degrees - in International Transportation Management, and Maritime and Naval Studies -  position students well to advance in their careers and become leaders in their fields. Both programs are offered online and on campus. International Transportation Management offers certificates in supply chain management and international ship chartering. The maritime and naval studies program blends courses in politics, naval tactics and the humanities.

Traditionally, graduates have high career-placement rates in their professional fields within three months after graduation and the highest starting salaries in the nation.

Find out more at www.sunymaritime.edu.


\​

summary: Singularly interested in working towards a just and sustainable world for all.
job title: Project Manager, High Performance Consulting Studio
linkedin description:
Re:Vision is a deep green architecture and sustainability consulting practice dedicated to the design of high-performance buildings and sustainable communities.  In our work, we seek to re-vision and restore the balance between natural and built environments.  Since 2002, Re:Vision’s portfolio has grown to include a range of unique commercial, institutional, and residential projects that include:  Net-Zero Energy verified, Passive House certified, LEED Platinum, Living Building certified, and/or common sense green.  

As an early adopter of sustainable design, Re:Vision has an extensive track record of successful projects that represent the following key services:
-	Architectural design for green buildings—commercial, institutional, and residential
-	Technical sustainable design consulting for other designers, contractors, and owners
-	Green certification management (LEED, Passive House, Living Building Challenge) for designers, contractors, and owners
-	Performance testing, including indoor air quality testing, infrared imaging, and blower door testing
-	WUFI and Passive House modeling and verifier services
-	Materials vetting for toxicity and sustainable attributes
-	Green operations and maintenance implementation
-	Professional green design charrettes and community engagement
-	Sustainability-related education and training
-	Fundraising support for green buildings
-	Owner’s representation for green buildings

Most of Re:Vision’s work is secured through recommendations or for repeat clients that value Re:Vision’s fresh approach and credible guidance.  In both our architecture and consulting work, we thrive on close collaboration and finding creative solutions to everyday problems.

Re:Vision is a licensed architectural practice and certified B-Corporation (for-benefit corporation) that demonstrates comprehensive and transparent social and environmental performance standards.

Inspire is a clean energy technology company on a mission to transform the way people access clean energy and accelerate the world toward a net-zero carbon future. Through a subscription model, Inspire allows customers to access 100% clean energy for one flat monthly price. Now customers can pay one flat rate for their electricity supply each month, while supporting a more sustainable future.

Founded in 2014, Inspire has made it easy for hundreds of thousands of households to access clean energy, reduce their reliance on fossil fuels, and join in the fight against climate change.

location: New York, New York, United States
linkedin description:
At Adore Me we take on seemingly impossible challenges. In 2011, we were founded to solve a single problem: help women buy bras online. It might seem like a simple task, but a bra is one of the most complex and personal garments in existence. Managing the design, procurement, logistics, and customer experience involved is an uphill climb, but one that built our company to take on increasingly greater challenges.

Adore Me grew into the first major online player in lingerie, as well as the first to introduce inclusive sizing in the category. We launched a wholly-owned logistics center, Adore Me Services, in 2017, the same year we became profitable (something very important to us). We've launched a pioneering try-at-home shopping service, a number of innovation-focused satellite brands, and most importantly, an affordable sustainability model that is transforming our entire business to make sustainable clothing available to consumers of all shapes, sizes, and spending abilities.

Adore Me believes fashion can be a force for good, for everyone.

summary:
Noemi Polo (b. 1990, Italy) is an architect and creative director specializing in spatial and experiential activations, working mainly in fashion, art and music. After receiving her master’s in architecture from the University of Applied Arts in Vienna, in 2018, she received the art and architecture fellowship by the MAK Center for Art & Architecture, which was followed by a teaching position at SCI ARC Institute of Architecture.

She works with brands and clients to facilitate special projects and to consult on strategy, creative direction, and spatial design. Polo has worked on numerous projects, experiences, and events with fashion brands such as SSENSE, On, Saint Laurent, Calvin Klein, Doublet, MISBHV, and Praying, involving artists such as Ida Ekbland, Michele Lamy, and Sterling Ruby and musicians such as Post Malone, Yves Tumor and Sophie. 

She is also the founder of AMOR: a design studio specializing in radical spatial design while embracing creative production, concept activation and curation. Moving seamlessly through culture and commerce, the production of space is the foundation of Amor’s practice. Recent projects include a spatial activation for Versace at the SSENSE store in Montreal ; a concept beauty store for DOVER STREET MARKET Los Angeles ; a MARNI happening and campaign with musician Yves Tumor for Dazed Magazine ; an exhibition of objects for the home and life with Noah Dillon,Jordan Wolfson, Mowalola, Dese Escobar in a home in Venice,CA.

education school linkedin description (2:
Università Iuav di Venezia is one of the leading universities in Europe and across the world in the fields of architecture, design, fashion, visual arts, urban and regional planning, and theatre.

Established in 1926 as one of the first Architecture Schools in Italy, Iuav combines a renowned tradition with a strong commitment to permanent innovation while putting the design process at the core of the whole educational experience. 

Degree programmes and courses in English, a wide network of worldwide partners in teaching and research, a number of visiting academics and professionals and vibrant student community from all over the world make Iuav an international university. 

Iuav is strategically and conveniently located in the heart of Venice historical centre, which greatly benefits students and staff in terms of cultural and sport opportunities.

summary:
Managing Partner of RBW.  Designs and manufactures LED Luminaires for hospitality, workplace, and residential projects. 

Driven by technology, simplicity & creativity, the organization merges the industrial and the elegant, engineering warm, dimmable solutions that are as beautiful as they are innovative. 
The results are intelligent and iconic, simple yet expressive.

Specialties:  Management, Strategic Design/ Product Development.
linkedin description:
As an award-winning, independent design and manufacturing company headquartered in Kingston, New York, RBW is a brand for architects and designers looking for a higher quality of light. Our forward-thinking, technology-driven approach invents lighting solutions that are out of the ordinary—products that take on unprecedented shapes, or make subtle upgrades on familiar forms. Each of our collections embodies a distinct personality while upholding the hallmarks of RBW’s family DNA: Intuitive ease and simplicity. Integrity of craft and material. High-quality lighting with a playful point of view.

Light is a powerful thing. At RBW, we believe in the power of light to create atmosphere—to enliven the little things, like our morning routines, or the moments we spend with friends. We believe that light helps shape our well-being and improves everyday life: Light can fill a room with a sense of optimism. It can energize and motivate. And at the end of the day, it can also help us relax and unwind. We use light to positively transform environments, communities, and lives.

🤝 Trusted Partner
We forge long-term relationships as trusted partners of choice. Authenticity & Integrity are the cornerstones of who we are.

🌐 Better Together
We achieve excellence together as a diverse team.

🌱 Committed to Grow
We see roadblocks as opportunities. Our growth mindset leads with optimism and initiative.

✨ Make it Awesome
We believe business needs to be a force for good. We commit to a net positive impact on the environment and our community through lighting and atmosphere.

education school linkedin description (1: RISD is a college and museum founded in Providence, RI in 1877, where making starts with a question, creativity sparks progress and challenging the status quo is the norm. Today, our community of 2,518 students engaged in 44 full-time bachelor’s and master’s degree programs cultivates a critical exchange of ideas between artists, designers and scholars that will help to shape the future. Through a cross-disciplinary curriculum of studio-based learning and rigorous study in the liberal arts, RISD students are encouraged to develop their own personal creative processes, but are united by one guiding principle: in order to create, one must question.\n\nRhode Island School of Design welcomes your opinions and encourages open discussion in a respectful and meaningful way. RISD reserves the right to remove any comments that harass, abuse, threaten or violate the rights of others.

summary: Team leader with a demonstrated history at B Lab, a nonprofit serving and certifying businesses. Strong program and project management professional skilled in Nonprofit Organizations, Corporate Social Responsibility, Policy Analysis, Sustainability, and Entrepreneurship.
job description:
B Lab Global is a nonprofit organization that through its international network of organizations leads economic systems change to support our collective vision of an inclusive, equitable, and regenerative economy. B Lab drives this systemic change by: 

- Building a global community of Certified B Corporations who meet high standards of verified, overall social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability; 
- Promoting Impact Governance using innovative corporate structures like the benefit corporation to align the interests of business with those of society and to help high impact businesses be built to last; 
- Helping tens of thousands of businesses, investors, and institutions manage their impact by using the B Impact Assessment and the impact of the businesses with whom they work -- with as much rigor as their profits

As a Director on the Certification & Verification Team, I have experience:
- Growing and leading a global team of 50+ people
- Overseeing the Certification and review of B Corporations and other businesses using the B Impact Assessment
linkedin description:
B Lab is transforming the global economy to benefit all people, communities, and the planet. A leader in economic systems change, our global network creates standards, policies, and tools for business, and we certify companies — known as B Corps — who are leading the way. 

To date, our community includes over 9,500 Certified B Corps positively impacting more than 950,000 workers in 102 countries and 161 industries, and more than 300,000 companies that manage their impact with our B Impact Assessment and SDG Action Manager tools.

2020 Fast Company Most Innovative Companies Honoree.
job description (2):
As Manager of the Certification & Verification Team, I:
- Directly managed the Certification process and review of B Corporations and other businesses using the B Impact Assessment
- Participated in standards development initiatives to create Large Company and Health & Safety standards
- Grew and trained in-house and external partners
- Led risk and contract reviews, product development, and performed key data analysis

linkedin description (4):
Lehigh is a premier residential research university, ranked in the top tier of national research universities each year. We are a coeducational, nondenominational, private university that offers a rigorous academic environment for undergraduate and graduate students from across the globe.

Lehigh offers majors and programs in five colleges: the College of Arts and Sciences, the College of Business, the College of Health, the P.C. Rossin College of Engineering and Applied Science and the College of Education.

More than 5,000 undergraduate and 2,000 graduate students call Lehigh home.​ Located in Pennsylvania’s scenic Lehigh Valley, the campus is in close proximity to both New York City and Philadelphia. Lehigh is comprised of 2,358 acres, making it one of the largest private universities in the country. 

Since 1865, generations of students have chosen Lehigh for their educational experience. They know Lehigh is a place where they can make strong personal connections with faculty, conduct research in diverse fields of study, thrive in a dynamic campus community, form lasting bonds with Lehigh alumni, and learn from their own life experiences.
